title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Cook spaghetti. Fry bacon until crispy. Beat eggs and mix with grated Parmesan cheese. Combine hot spaghetti with egg mixture and bacon, stirring quickly to create a creamy sauce. Season with black pepper and serve immediately.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato-based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices. Grill the chicken until slightly charred. Sauté onions, then add spices and tomato puree. Simmer the sauce and mix in grilled chicken. Stir in heavy cream and cook until thickened. Serve hot.

title: Beef Stroganoff
summary: A Russian dish of sautéed beef served in a sauce with sour cream.
instructions: Slice beef into thin strips. Sauté onions and mushrooms in butter. Remove and brown the beef. Sprinkle flour over the beef and mix. Return onions and mushrooms, then add sour cream. Simmer gently until sauce thickens. Serve over rice or noodles.

title: Vegetable Stir-Fry
summary: A quick and healthy mix of fresh vegetables sautéed in a flavorful sauce.
instructions: Chop vegetables into bite-sized pieces. Heat sesame oil in a wok or skillet. Stir-fry vegetables over high heat for 5-7 minutes. Add soy sauce and stir to coat evenly. Cook for an additional minute and serve hot.

title: Shrimp Scampi
summary: Garlic butter shrimp served over a bed of linguine pasta.
instructions: Cook linguine until al dente. Sauté garlic in butter. Add shrimp and cook until pink. Squeeze lemon juice over shrimp and mix in parsley. Toss cooked linguine with shrimp and sauce. Serve with extra parsley garnish.

title: Margherita Pizza
summary: A simple Italian pizza with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil.
instructions: Roll out pizza dough and place on a baking sheet. Spread olive oil and sliced tomatoes over the dough. Add shredded mozzarella and bake at 200°C for 12-15 minutes. Top with fresh basil leaves before serving.
